You know, its a nice game. Sadly in DBD you can cheat and this cheat is not being removed. Survivors alter their resolution to create the so called stretched resolution cheat, this allows them to see waaaaaay more of the game and waayyy more than was intended. This removes the possibility for the killer to trick them in any way and it has lead to many killers leaving game and this created long and unfair matchmaking. So buy it if you  want a few hours fun but if you really want to compete as killer you will just burn out eventually. The higher the rank the more people cheat.

Update 100 hours later -> still the same, but now with the new ranking system the game is less fun.

BEST GAME EVER 100/10 would recommend to anyone

Don't get me wrong, I like the game but it has a lot of major issues. The biggest or one of the biggest is the community, they're always five seconds apart from disemboweling each other and being as annoying as possible because they've been bullied their whole life and a game about four teens terrorizing a killer makes them feel big and strong. The second problem is the game itself with how tedious or obnoxious it can get with absolutely busted perks or sweat teams. As a killer you need to micro-manage four people who are trying to be productive as possible which is a fun and tasking experience that has slowly made me more patient and not care about two or so generators popping at the start of the round. But, sometimes it can just be a little much with people being super sweaty like letting their teammates die on the hooks for gen progress, four full black claudettes that religiously hide instead of encourage chase, terrible loop and map game design, and how stressful this game is on a game to game basis cause something is always going to go wrong whether in your favor or in the survivors.
  Usually as a killer you want to hit a sweet spot because when everyone's afk and you get a free win you don't feel anything because what even was the challenge? Stress is a key part of this game because it has a pay off at the end when you sacrifice everyone. About survivor though, it's a different story. I haven't played much survivor as I have killer but survivor boils down to "do gen, occasionally run when a killer is nearby, get facecamped or tunneled cause you're at a low rank because you don't deal enough with these types of people". I haven't tried this version of DBD as I have with Xbox, clocking in maybe roughly 600 hours on the console version so the community could be slightly different. Survivor like killer is fun and rewarding when you get out of a tricky scenario but survivor also relies on you having to have three other equally competent people to win which is a hellscape in solo q. SWF is what killers toss and toil in their beds having relentless nightmares about and it's basically when the entire survivor team has impeccable communication. SWF usually is just a bunch of friends playing around or all people with 10k hours that have studied the game's code and statistics in and out with a full compendium on how killers and survivor's brains work. 
      Every game has its issues but because this game has little competition on the market the game devs are kinda stupid as hell and take a load of time to fix egregious issues. The game is rewarding based on how lucky you are at times with map rng but still not unbeatable with that, no match is really the same and so people often have to improvise. This game is just okay but it sure is different than anything else currently out.

This game is still the best asymetric game out right now.

The biggest flaw this game had was its lack of identity. Earlier in the game (4 years ago) they wanted this to be a very fair game with cool and very strong tactics on both sides. This proved to be very difficult and led to a very disliked game from the casual crowd. Playing used to be a very hard ordeal and I took it upon myself to learn the hardest killer in the game (Nurse) back then. What I found after weeks of harsh games was a very solid skillset that allowed me to 4k game after game. 
I bring this up because back then there was like 2 or 3 tracking perks (Nurses Calling and Bitter Murmer) and the survivors had a plethora of tools to bully the killer. Insta-revives, sabotaging hooks that never respawned, add-ons to speed up gen rushing like crazy, etc. You can see it in all the old reviews. 

Moving to today's current build. The game is way more killer oriented and casual survivors have not liked the changes since they started gaining momentum. Many people claim the game is broken now but in reality BHVR finally realized what they wanted to be their game and executed it. It is supposed to feel like a horror movie where only one person lives to tell the tale. They want the survivors players to feel the anguish and anxiety of a horror movie scenario. They nailed it.

I am a killer main but I play survivor with my red rank friends. They know the ins and outs of synergy and great endgame hook saves. When I play against them as killer I cant help but feel frustrated against players of this caliber but this should not be easy for the killer either. 

With that being said, once you can get past the learning curve and understand how to play as a team while utilizing whatever role you want to fill in the game. It is a very fun and unique experience I have not felt in my 20+ years of gaming. It is not perfect by any means and can always be improved.

Before you make a verdict on this game, ask yourself. Do you want to know what it is like to be in a horror movie? Where quick decisions and communication can literally be life or death? This is the game for you.

If you want this game with guns, buy Predator Hunting Grounds.

Davvero non me lo aspettavo. Non avrei scommesso nulla su questo titolo, e invece devo ammetterlo: Dead By Daylight mi ha divertito e mi diverte ancora tantissimo.

Non avevo mai provato titoli con meccaniche del genere, cioè 4 giocatori che vanno ad impersonare i sopravvissuti e un giocatore invece lo spietato killer. Già l'idea e l'atmosfera sono ottime, il tutto unito a quella sensazione di "dai, ne faccio un'altra e stacco", hanno reso la mia esperienza con questo titolo molto godibile.
Durante le prime ore di gioco ammetto che lascia un tantino spiazzati, non si sa come muoversi, come funziona esattamente il tutto. Via via però, migliorando con il rank e apprendendo tutte le varie sfaccettature del gameplay, ci si rende conto di quanto sia nettamente più profondo di quel che sembra all'inizio.

Il matchmaking che tutti criticano... io l'ho trovato ottimo, cerca una partita in modo veloce e in poco tempo si avvia il caricamento di quest'ultima.

Soffre di sbilanciamenti nel caso in cui i sopravvissuti decidono di collaborare tramite il "party" della console, rendendo il lavoro del killer molto più complesso.

Purtroppo non è tutto oro ciò che luccica, perchè DBD soffre di tantissimi problemi tecnici, un po per difetti in sé del titolo, e un po per via delle connessioni. E si, perché ad hostare la partita (almeno da quello che ho capito) è il killer stesso, e se quest'ultimo avrà una connessione scadente ne risentirà tutta la partita.
Tutte queste problematiche sono semplicemente riassumibili in: corsa a scatti e teletrasporti; killer che quando colpisce l'aria in realtà becca proprio te; animazioni sballate in diverse occasioni; killer che ti colpisce quasi sempre mentre hai già scavalcato un bancale o una finestra; cali di frame; lag; compenetrazioni.

In sostanza però, come detto, DBD si è rivelato davvero un gran bel gioco, e peccato per quei problemi tecnici altrimenti si sarebbe meritato un voto ancora più alto

I enjoy this game, its not perfect but its very fun if youre not too focused on ranking up or points. I say this because a lot of the time other peoples actions, wether it be disconnecting, camping, tunneling, of afking, will make you not in control of your own progress. A leaver penalty or actual effective report buttons would make this game 10/10. Good game overall.

DBD is amazing and the transition from playing thousands of hours on xbox to now playing on PC was wonderful. A truly challenging game that always drives you to become better with an endless amount of things to learn and get better at, highly, highly recommend.
